questions.clue: This type of sushi is named after the Japanese tradition of pressing fish on rice, often with a bamboo mat.
Popular in Western sushi, this roll combines avocado, imitation crab, and cucumber.
Pizza sushi, an American-Japanese fusion, involves rolling traditional sushi ingredients with unconventional toppings like mozzarella cheese.
This vinegared rice dish garnished with raw fish, vegetables, and sometimes fruits, became globally popular in the late 20th century.
In 1910, this Tokyo district's sushi stalls popularized serving fish atop vinegared rice, changing sushi culture forever.

categories.name: Literary Terrains: Books with a Journey

questions.clue: 'The Hobbit' begins with hobbit Bilbo Baggins being whisked away on an adventure by this wizard.
In 'Around the World in 80 Days,' Phileas Fogg uses this mode of transport for most of his journey.
This book by Jack Kerouac features the character Sal Paradise traveling across America.
'The Road' is a novel about a post-apocalyptic journey taken by an unnamed father and son, written by this author.
In 'Life of Pi,' the protagonist shares a lifeboat with this fearsome companion while lost at sea.

categories.name: Cheese, Please: Pizza Variations Across Borders

questions.clue: For $200: Known for its thick crust and deep dish style, this type of pizza originated in this windy U.S. city.
For $400: This pizza from New York City is famous for its large, foldable slices and thin crust.
For $600: Topped with tomato, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil, this classic Neapolitan pizza shares its name with an Italian queen.
For $800: A cheese-laden pie, this Detroit pizza style is characterized by its rectangular shape and automotive roots.
For $1000: Combining raw fish with rice and traditional pizza elements, this fusion food trend is particularly popular in Japan and California.

categories.name: Innovations in Technology: From Idea to Marketplace

questions.clue: For $200, this food delivery service started in 2004 provides both pizza and sushi delivery options.
In 1995, this online auction site was founded and quickly became a hub for buying and selling, including consumer electronics and collectibles.
First sold in 1984, this brick phone revolutionized wireless communication and was created by Martin Cooper's team at Motorola.
Developed by Maser Technology, this 3D printer known as the 'Foodini' focuses on printing edible items like sushi or pizza.
This operating system, released in 2007, laid the foundation for seamless integration of mobile apps, including those delivering pizzas and sushi.
In the late 19th century, he composed the famous New World Symphony, drawing inspiration from Native American and African-American music.
This German composer's Symphony No. 6, also known as the Pastoral Symphony, was inspired by his love for nature and countryside walks.
His ballet 'The Firebird' was inspired by Russian folklore and premiered in 1910 in Paris.
Dating back to the Romantic era, this composer's work was notably influenced by his intense relationship with novelist George Sand.
Inspired by returning to his roots, this Czech composer wrote 'From My Life', a string quartet reflecting significant events in his life.

final.clue: This unique fusion dish, combining Italian and Japanese cuisine, features raw fish traditionally found in sushi served on a thin, bread-based crust typically associated with a classic Italian favorite.
